current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To curb unfair and deceptive practices during assertion of patents, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this Act as the

quote.#tail:
)  shall promulgate rules to prohibit unfair or deceptive acts and practices in the sending of
			 written communication that states that the intended recipient of the
			 written communication, or any person affiliated with the intended
			 recipient, is infringing or may be infringing the patent of and bears
			 liability or owes compensation to another.  Such rules shall establish the
			 disclosures that a written communication to which this subsection applies
			 must contain, including—

text.#text: The rules promulgated by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall promulgate rules to prohibit unfair or deceptive assertions in written
			 communication
			 to which

applies.  Such rules shall specify the actions
			 that constitute an unfair or deceptive assertion, including—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The

an assertion that falsely threatens administrative or judicial relief will be sought if
			 compensation is not paid or the infringement is not otherwise resolved;
an assertion that lacks a reasonable basis in fact or law; and
an assertion that is likely to materially mislead a reasonable intended recipient.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide education and awareness to the public regarding unfair or deceptive
			 patent assertions.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall promulgate the rules under this Act in accordance with

shall enforce this Act in the same manner, by the same means, and with the
			 same jurisdiction, powers, and duties as though all applicable terms and
			 provisions of the

text.#text:
A violation of a rule promulgated under this Act shall be treated as a violation of a rule defining
			 an unfair or deceptive act or practice under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: .  The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 18(a)(1)(B) of the
			 Federal Trade Commission Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act/s:18/ss:a/p:1/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
were
			 incorporated into and made a part of this Act.  Any person who violates
			 this Act shall be subject to the penalties and entitled to the privileges
			 and immunities provided in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act
usc/15/41/etseq
Federal Trade Commission Act
usc/15/41/etseq

text.#text:
In any case in which the attorney general of a State, or
		an official or agency of a State, has reason to believe that an interest of the
		residents of that State has been or is threatened or adversely affected by
			 engagement of any person subject to a rule promulgated under this Act in a
			 practice that violates the rule,  the attorney
		general, official, or agency of the State, as parens patriae, may bring a civil
		action on behalf of the residents of the State in an appropriate district court of
			 the
		United States—

to enjoin further
		violation of the rule by the defendant;

to compel
		compliance with the rule;
to obtain damages, restitution, or other compensation on behalf of such residents;
to obtain such further and other relief as the court considers appropriate; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act/s:2/ss:g/p:2

text.#text:
to obtain civil
		penalties in the amount determined under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amount determined under this
		paragraph is the amount calculated by multiplying the number of separate violations
			 of a rule
			 by an amount not greater
		than $16,000.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act/s:2/ss:g/p:1/sp:E

text.#text: For purposes of imposing a civil penalty under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is after 1 year after
		the date of enactment of this Act, and each year thereafter, the amount
		specified in

shall be increased by the percentage increase in the
		Consumer Price Index published on that date from the Consumer Price Index
		published the previous year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparency in Assertion of Patents Act/s:2/ss:g/p:2/sp:A

to

upon
		so intervening, to be heard on all matters arising in the civil action; and

to
		file petitions for appeal of a decision in the civil action.

text.#text:
The State shall provide prior written notice of any
		civil action under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has instituted a civil action for violation of this Act, no State attorney
		general, or official or agency of a State, may bring an action under this
		subsection during the pendency of that action against any defendant named in
		the complaint of the Commission for any violation of this Act alleged in the
		complaint.
